meanings.definition: To put at risk or in peril.
meanings.sent1: Running across the street without looking is dangering yourself.
meanings.sent2: She was dangering her health by not wearing a helmet while biking.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was dangering its acorn by leaving it unattended near the hungry cat.
meanings.sent4: By not studying for the test, he was dangering his chances of passing.
meanings.sent5: Ignoring the warning signs is dangering your safety.

meanings.definition: The act of exposing to danger.
meanings.sent1: The dangering of the hikers was due to the approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The dangering of the workers was a result of the faulty equipment.
meanings.sent3: The dangering of the cookies by the mischievous dog led to a messy kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The dangering of the fragile vase by the playful cat ended in a shattered mess.
meanings.sent5: The dangering of the secret mission was a risk they were willing to take.
